pros: Good hourly rates and shift differentials.
cons: Wish they had a robust trauma program

pros: There is a Good work culture
cons: Pay could be way better

pros: Manager is great and always available to help the techs out with anything they need!
cons: Low pay, low staff, high turnover!

job_title: ICU Registered Nurse in Richardson, TX
pros: Team you worked with was depended upon how well you bonded with the rest of the staff.
cons: Very overworked. Lots of staff took off for being sick. Unsafe nurse/patient ratios. You'd have to attend weekly mandatory meetings and not get paid for it. You'd also have to your lunch taken out of your paycheck even if you didn't take a lunch because it was nearly impossible for the patient load. Management never listened to concerns and moral was low.

pros: Laidback, no micromanagement, nice people. Make your own schedule for the most part
cons: Too laidback, not as organized as big facilities. Nightshift has a high turnover rate

pros: Pays better than local hospitals for PRN work
cons:
Toxic environment of workers
Other departments not pulling their share of work
Overworked or asked to work a lot of additional hours
No true lead or guidance
Huge workload and unorganized environment
Favoritism

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in McKinney, TX
pros: Amazing Ladies to work with especially on nights, easy to get along with and very Team oriented.
cons: Management is not great with communication.

pros: Great employees and work environment. Easy to fit in
cons: Little to no bonuses and incentive to work more

review_title: Consider other options if you can!
job_title: Registered Nurse, Critical Care in Richardson, TX
pros: Most of the nursing staff is friendly
cons: Poor management. During interview, management says that ICU has 2 ICU patients at one time. Left this facility due to unsafe staffing ratios (up to 4 ICU patients to 1 RN at one time) - management claims to "staff by acuity." Lots of favoritism, especially towards "VIP" guests. Avoid working for this place if you have other options.

pros: Small enough hospital where relationships among leaders become extremely strong and productive. Continuous striving for patient excellence and patient centered. Supportive of education and certifications.
cons: No differentials for certifications or higher degrees. Other hospitals display this by adding $1.00 to $5.00 bump in hourly wages. End of year bonuses are unattainable and significantly lower than other hospitals. Benefits are also not as good they could be. Last year the employer contributed life insurance amount was decreased which was disheartening.

review_title: The cold feel as you approach the hospital is exactly what it feels like to work in it.
pros: Small hospital, very convenient, and a very great gift shop!
cons: Where to start?  Incidents covered up so a lot of rumors. Also rumors between and/or about staff. Inept leadership from managers up. The leadership that wants to work and make a difference is pushed down and stifled by the CNO. Well really by the narcissistic and misogynistic CEO. The CNO is really just an old woman who is used in the hospital's game of chess. "Crisis staffing" is a constant.

pros: My fellow staff members are a great team. We work well together and enjoy each others company. The pediatricians we work with are awesome and they clearly love their roles. The hospital system is supportive and provides the equipment and staffing we require.
cons: Personally the only con I really have is a personal one. I live an hour away, therefore, my 12 hour shift becomes a 14 hour day. I take resposibility for this, I chose this hospital and am pleased to work here.

pros: The nurses were very patient, helpful, and knowledgeable. They went out of their way to make sure I was learning what I needed to know to be a great nurse.
cons: The rules are pretty strict. Some people may not like having to have so many rules.

review_title: It is a Horrible place to work with.
pros: Nothing other than pay check..
cons: Very rude and arrogant management, Only focused on making more profit, an excessively pressurized job place, have no human dignity.    Nobody is satisfied here  other than the employer, very high patient to nurse ratio that make job-overload always. They write you off and report to group for silly matters which are considered simple daily human errors at other places

pros: Patients and employees are equally treated with respect.  There is a culture of solidarity in providing excellent care to our clients.
cons: Provide better mode of medication administration/charting. The WOW is very heavy to push around for 12 to 13 hours per day.

pros: Coworkers are usually really nice regardless of department.  Lots of feedback from management.  Plenty of assistance available upon request. Tuition reimbursement program.
cons: Benefits aren't as good as they were prior to the merge with Big Methodist. Very little upward mobility assistance from management.

pros: The nurses, techs, doctors were amazing to work with.
cons: Co-workers I worked with in the admitting team were immature, gossipy and rude.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Garland, TX
pros: Beautiful Campus, great thought process on nurse work stations and break rooms, Great benefits, awards etc.
cons: I'm not a fan of putting a sticker on my car for parking. Don't like the badge clock in system. Those are small things.

review_title: Very professional and safe place to work.
job_title: Medical Billing Specialist in Rayville, LA
pros: Family oriented, willing to build with their employees, safe, trustworthy company.
cons: I haven't worked there yet.

pros: Some of the best staff I've ever worked with!
cons: Poor Management, Zero Leadership. Extremely poor differentials. No respect for clinical staff.

job_title: Computer Programmer II in Los Angeles, CA
pros: The people here are great, depending on what unit you work, everyone works as a team!
cons: Some managers are hateful, others are great. Just depends on your unit.

pros: Coworkers are awesome people, good teamwork
